function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Unequal distribution of resilience research across different domains may lead to neglect of certain areas of application, including contagious disease resilience.","Impact":"Increased vulnerability to contagious diseases in disciplines with limited resilience research.","Mitigation":"Encourage interdisciplinary collaboration and funding for research in disciplines with less resilience research.","Technologies":"Data visualization tools, collaboration platforms, funding databases.","People":"Researchers, policymakers, funding agencies.","Owner":"Research institutions, funding agencies, governmental organizations."},{"Description":"Limited research on resilience in the engineering domain may result in inadequate preparedness for engineering-related contagious disease outbreaks.","Impact":"Lack of resilience in engineering may impede effective response to contagious disease outbreaks in engineering contexts.","Mitigation":"Invest in engineering-focused resilience research and incorporate contagious disease preparedness into engineering design practices.","Technologies":"Engineering simulation software, public health models, interdisciplinary research forums.","People":"Engineers, public health experts, policymakers.","Owner":"Engineering institutions, research funding organizations."},{"Description":"Uneven distribution of resilience-related research across different years may indicate gaps in understanding the evolving nature of contagious disease threats and preparedness.","Impact":"Lack of up-to-date knowledge may hinder effective response to contemporary contagious disease challenges.","Mitigation":"Encourage ongoing research and publication on current and emerging contagious disease threats.","Technologies":"Data analysis tools, academic publishing platforms, research funding databases.","People":"Researchers, public health officials, policymakers.","Owner":"Research institutions, academic publishers, government health agencies."}]}
